subject: p17168993
History: Lethargy, low O2 sat, question infectious process.
Findings: Rotated positioning. Compared with, allowing for technical differences, there has been improvement in the vascular and CHF findings. Lungs are hyperinflated and the diaphragms are flattened, consistent with COPD. There is mild-to-moderate cardiomegaly. There is aneurysmal dilatation of the aortic arch, measuring up to 61 cm on the lateral view. There is increased density in the left lower lobe which may represent a combination of atelectasis and changes in opacity related to the vascular findings.
Impression: Please see detailed report of chest CTA from describing extensive vascular abnormalities, right lung apex spiculated nodule and upper mediastinal lymph node. No CHF or effusion is identified. Doubt infectious consolidation. Please see comment above.
